Adult.description: Snowy Egrets are often mistaken for juvenile Little Blue Herons, but they have an all black bill and black legs compared with the grayish bill and greenish-yellow legs of Little Blues (note that juvenile Snowy Egrets have yellowish legs). Snowies also lack the vague dusky primary-feather tips of juvenile Little Blues.

Nonbreeding adult dark morph.description: Adult dark-morph Reddish Egrets are larger than Little Blue Herons. They have rusty-colored necks, rather than purple-blue necks like Little Blue Herons.

Adult breeding white morph.description: Compared to juvenile Little Blue Herons, white-morph Reddish Egrets have darker legs and have a pink base to the bill rather than bluish gray.

Nonbreeding Adult.description: Tricolored Herons have white bellies that contrast with their blue chests unlike Little Blue Herons, which have a dark belly.
